result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick Michael Moon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to case 14CF130, with credit for 25 days time served.
Extended Supervision and Probation conditions same

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections. (applies to both cases 14CF130 and 14CF612).
Obtain and maintain employment----minimum of 20 hours per week.

No firearms; weapons.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.
No contact with victim, Roxanne G. Any violations can result in new charges.

Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling and continue programming.
Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
Maintain absolute sobriety. No drugs. No alcohol.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Restitution is set at zero.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Defendant must attend AA meeting and NA per week.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.

timeConds.notes:
Stayed pending review on 6-13-14
*1/11/2016  Order for Commitment signed/filed.  To serve 30 days, straight time. No good time credit.

records.addlTxt:
Signed and filed 3-7-16: Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Hearing, Judgment for Court Ordered Financial Obligations.  

COURT ORDER/JUDGMENT
The COURT FINDS, ORDERS, AND ADJUDGES:

Court costs:  Judgment is granted against the defendant for unpaid court ordered financial obligations in the amount of 588.60.  

The clerk is directed to enter this judgment on the judgment and lien docket without fee.  Interest will be added from the date of entry of judgment at the rate allowed by statute.


*Copy to District Attorney's Office and Agent J. Handrow #30706*

Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and 
forwarded to Judge Havas
for review. os

records.addlTxt: Email from DOC Agent Justin Handrow that the defendant is currently serving an MSDF institution ATR and will not be present at the Review Hearing scheduled 8-29-2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 4.   Probation Review Hearing scheduled 8-29-2014 at 1:30 pm in branch 4 is cancelled and removed from the court's calendar.   mld
dated 8-1-2014, to the court, from Roxanne G., received and filed.   mld

Defendant Patrick Michael Moon in court.  Evan Glaberson appeared with Jaclyn Schwartz (under the student practice rule), for the State of Wisconsin.
  DOC agent Justin Handrow also in court.
The Court ordered another review hearing to further monitor the defendant.  The Court ordered the stay on the condition time to continue until the next court date.  
Case adjourned to 8-29-2014 at 1:30 pm. at 1:30 p.m. for probation review hearing in Branch 4.   mld.

Defendant Patrick Michael Moon in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Patrick Michael Moon in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 
AS TO CHARGE:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  

 Courts finds that State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS, (CONSECUTIVE to case 2014CF130), with credit for 25 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

The Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 2 YEARS with the following conditions:  
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 50 DAYS
   in the House of Correction.  Stayed pending review.
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Roxanne G. 
   Any violations can result in new charges.
* Obtain and maintain employment.  
   --- Minimum of 20 hours per week. 
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by
   the Department of Corrections 
   (applies to both cases 2014CF130 and 2014CF612), 
   during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.  
* Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
* Restitution is set at zero.
* Defendant must attent AA or NA meetings per week.   
**COURT ORDERED PROBATION REVIEW HEARING IN BR. 4 ON 6-13-2014 AT 1:30 PM.
 Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.   mld

Defendant Patrick Michael Moon in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Patrick Michael Moon in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  Upon the motion of State, Court ordered the following cases consolidated for thepurposes of trial:  Cases 2014CF130 and 2014CF000612.  Court ordered case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 3-10-2014 at 1:30 pm.   mld
No open underlying case. Case transfered in error to branch 23. Case is returned to branch 04, Judge Flanagan.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ROXANNE G.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Patrick Michael Moon in court with attorney Terese M Dick.  Defendant Patrick Michael Moon in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant HAS A LOWER PENDING CASE AND is advised this case is assigned to Judge GRADY, Branch 23.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
